Column Comment.0: STANDARD IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for the standard used in the isotopeanalysis.
Column Comment.1: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.5: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.6: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.7: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.8: SOURCE DOCUMENT: The literature source for the standard being used for this rowof data.
Column Comment.9: STANDARD NAME: A unique name for the standard used in this isotope analysis.
Column Comment.10: STANDARD VALUE: the value that has been recorded as coming from a standardisotope, as given in literature. This value is used for comparison to the measuredvalues.
Column Comment.11: STANDARD VALUE ERROR: the error value that has been recorded as coming froma standard isotope, as given in literature. This value is used for comparison to themeasured values, and helps you work out whether the measurement observed fallswithin the expected range for the isotope standard.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
